alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Newberry (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 29 at 2:41PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Fairfield, Newberry, Northern Lancaster and Southern Lancaster. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Hurricane Idalia will bring heavy rainfall to the northern and western Midlands beginning Wednesday afternoon and continuing into Thursday. Rainfall amounts will range from 3 to 4 inches with some locally higher amounts around 5 inches. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
